etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek hudro- ‘water’ + angeion ‘vessel’ (from the cup shape of its seed capsule)

definitions: a shrub or climbing plant with rounded or flattened flowering heads of small florets, the outer ones of which are typically infertile. Hydrangeas are native to Asia and America.

notes.text: Genus Hydrangea, family Hydrangeaceae: many species, in particular late hydrangea or panicled hydrangea(H. paniculata), an ornamental shrub that blooms in late summer, and bigleaf hydrangea (H. macrophylla), commonly grown for florists and as a houseplant

shortDefinitions: shrub or climbing plant with flowering heads of small florets
